action.action-desc: Mr. Graves of Louisiana (for himself and Mr. Moulton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of certain grants from being used to procure unmanned aircraft systems manufactured by Chinese companies, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Infrastructure Grant Security Act.

section.header: Prohibition on acquisition or operation of Chinese manufactured UAS using SMART grant funds
section.text: Section 25005(e)(3) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B) by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (C) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: to purchase, lease, or operate an unmanned aircraft system (as defined in section 44801 of title 49, United States Code) manufactured by—

clause.text: an entity domiciled in the People’s Republic of China; or
an entity, or a subsidiary or affiliate of an entity, that is subject to influence or control by—

subclause.text: the Government of the People’s Republic of China; or
